panels.musiclab_intro_panels_start_v2-415ec56a-:
#### âœ¨ Welcome to Music Lab âœ¨

Get ready to make music with code!
panels.musiclab_intro_panels_start_v2-d2e2064a-:
#### Using the tutorial

â†’ 1. Read the instructions.

â†’ 2. Drag blocks into the workspace.

â†’ 3. Press â–¶ Run to start your song.

â†’ 4. Press Continue for the next level.
panels.musiclab_intro_panels_start_v2-623c36d1-:
### Change the sound

Click on the sound block to access the sound library. 

Choose any sound you like!

https://studio.code.org/s/music-tutorial.long_instructions:
#### Play a Sound

1.  Drag the [play][0] block and connect it under [when run][1]. 
2.  Then press [Run][2].

validations.musiclab_intro_play_sound_34517aac-bcf5-: Nice work.  You played a sound!
validations.musiclab_intro_play_sound_10152a9d-29b4-: You found the Run button! Now, drag the [play][0] block and connect it under [when run][1].

https://studio.code.org/s/music-tutorial.long_instructions:
#### Play more sounds

Try playing one sound after another.

1.  Drag one or more [play][0] blocks into the program. 
2.  Then press [Run][1].

validations.musiclab_intro_change_sound_v2_6054328e-: Great work! You added new sounds to your song.
validations.musiclab_intro_change_sound_v2_9ddfc062-: Add at least one more sound.

panels.musiclab_intro_panels_playtogether_pdx-a:
### Repeat a sound

Choose a sound and set the number of times to play it using a repeat block.

https://studio.code.org/s/music-tutorial.long_instructions:
#### Repeat

Save time by using repeat to play the same sounds over and over.

1.  Click [Control][0] to find the repeat block. 
2.  Use the [repeat][1] block to play the same sound [3][2] times.

validations.musiclab_intro_repeat_elementary_1eaff1e: Nice work. You successfully played a sound three times!
validations.musiclab_intro_repeat_elementary_81debb7: You repeated a sound twice. Now make it play it [three][0] times.
validations.musiclab_intro_repeat_elementary_ef93b77: You played a sound once. Now make it play it three times by putting a [3][0] in the [repeat][1] block.
validations.musiclab_intro_repeat_elementary_7870662: Play a sound three times. Attach a [repeat][0] block to [when run][1]. Then put a [play][2] block inside of it.

panels.musiclab_intro_panels_playtogether_pdx-a:
### Play Together

Play sounds at the same time! Drag two or more sounds into the **play together** block.

https://studio.code.org/s/music-tutorial.long_instructions:
#### Play Together

Try playing two or more sounds at the same time.

1.  Connect [play together][0] to [when run][1].
2.  Then, add two different [sounds][2] _into_ the [play together][3] block.

validations.musiclab_intro_play_together_elementary_: Nice work. Those two sounds are great together!
Great job playing one sound; now try playing two sounds together. Add two [play][0] blocks _into_ the [play together][1] block.
Please play two sounds together. Hint: Try using two different types of sounds to play together, like a drum and a bass beat!
validations.musiclab_tutorial_play_together_ebbe089b: No sounds have played yet. Connect a [play together][0] block under [when run][1]. Then, add two [play][2] blocks _into_ the [play together][3] block.

panels.musiclab_intro_panels_function_pdx-f1f65:
### Functions

Create a **function** to play a specific chunk of code whenever it's called. 

**First** build your function using the sounds you like.
panels.musiclab_intro_panels_function_pdx-952b5:
### Use your new function!

Now, you can use your new function anytime by choosing the block with your functionâ€™s name. 

This new block will **call** your function when you press Run.

https://studio.code.org/s/music-tutorial.long_instructions:
#### Functions

Organize your music using functions.

1.  Click [Functions][0]
2.  Attach [chorus][1] under [when run][2]
3.  What do you notice?

validations.musiclab_intro_function_elementary_328ae: Nice work.  You successfully used the function to play a sound.
validations.musiclab_intro_function_elementary_33cfa: Connect the "chorus" block under [when run][0] to play the sounds in the function.

panels.musiclab_intro_panels_trigger_pdx-5586b5:
### Play Live Music!

You can use triggers to play live music. 

First, code your **trigger** block with the sound you want it to play.
panels.musiclab_intro_panels_trigger_pdx-7930c0: Then, **trigger** your new sounds while your song is playing.

https://studio.code.org/s/music-tutorial.long_instructions:
#### Play Live

Now you are in control!

1.  Attach a [play][0] block to the [trigger][1] block.
2.  Press [Run][2].
3.  Press [1][3] to trigger the sound when you want it.

validations.musiclab_intro_trigger_elementary_7d8f34: Nice work.  You successfully played a sound by using the trigger.

panels.musiclab_intro_panels_trigger_pdx-5586b5:
### Compose your own melody!

Use the **play notes** block to compose your own melody.
panels.musiclab_intro_panels_trigger_pdx-7930c0:
### Compose your own beats!

Use the **play drums** block to compose your own beats.

Have fun!

https://studio.code.org/s/music-tutorial.long_instructions:
#### Customize a Melody

1.  Click on [Sounds][0] to find the [play notes][1] block.
2.  Attach a [play notes][2] block under [when run][3].
3.  Click the on the [play notes][4] block to compose a new melody.

validations.musiclab_intro_notes_v2_a40492dc-818f-4e: Try out the [play notes][0] block and compose your own melody.
validations.musiclab_tutorial_notes_cdc6aa6b-b5a7-45: Click on the [play notes][0] block and use the keyboard to create a custom melody.
validations.musiclab_intro_notes_v2_ca10f1fe-8755-49: Great! You composed your own melody.

https://studio.code.org/s/music-tutorial.long_instructions:
#### Customize a Drum Beat

1.  Click on [Sounds][0] to find the [play drums][1] block.
2.  Attach a play drums block under [when run][2].
3.  Click the [play drums][3] block to create custom beats.

validations.musiclab_intro_drums_v2_8a21d216-d589-41: Add the [play drums][0] block and make your own beats!
validations.musiclab_tutorial_drums_25bc1092-ffea-42: Click on the [play drums][0] block and use the beat maker to create a custom beat.

panels.musiclab_intro_panels_end_pdx-88ca8817-6:
